titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Walter Lyman Brown papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-01-20T10:50-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Description over photographs added from photograph card catalog - Paige Davenport

did.abstract: Photographs, correspondence, and writings relating to American relief work in Europe during and immediately after World War I.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Walter Lyman Brown papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: European director, American Relief Administration European Children's Fund; director, Rotterdam Office, Commission for Relief in Belgium.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photographs, correspondence, and writings relating to American relief work in Europe during and immediately after World War I.

controlaccess.corpname: American Relief Administration. European Children's Fund.
controlaccess.subject: International relief.
World War, 1914-1918--Belgium.
World War, 1914-1918--Civilian relief.

did.unittitle: Album of photographs depicting relief activities of the American Relief Administration European Children's Fund in Poland,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Book containing hand painted maps of the American Relief Administration European Children's Fund Mission to Poland's operations with statistics. Given to Walter Lyman Brown by American Relief Administration European Children's Fund Mission to Poland and the Polsko-Amerykański Komitet Pomocy Dzieciom.

did.unittitle: Album of The Commission for Relief in Belgium Rotterdam Office,
Autographed photographs of Herbert Hoover, William B. Poland, President Edvard Benes of Czechoslovakia, and Cardinal D. J. Mercier of Belgium,
Autographed photograph of President Michael Hainisch of Austria,
